meanings.definition: Not typical or characteristic of a particular group or situation.
meanings.sent1: The small sample size of the survey made the results unrepresentative of the entire population.
meanings.sent2: The painting was unrepresentative of the artist's usual style, causing confusion among art critics.
meanings.sent3: It was quite unrepresentative of her to arrive late, as she was usually very punctual.
meanings.sent4: The dark storm clouds were unrepresentative of the sunny weather forecasted for the day.
meanings.sent5: The broken clock was unrepresentative of the reliable timepieces the company usually produced.

meanings.definition: Not accurately or fairly portraying someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The caricature was unrepresentative of his true features, exaggerating his nose and ears.
meanings.sent2: The news article was unrepresentative of the actual events that took place, spreading misinformation.
meanings.sent3: Her attempt at imitating a British accent was unrepresentative of how it actually sounded, causing laughter among her friends.
meanings.sent4: The blurry photograph was unrepresentative of the beautiful scenery she had witnessed, failing to capture its true essence.
meanings.sent5: The movie trailer was unrepresentative of the film's actual plot, misleading many viewers.
